Project Gutenberg, founded in 1971, is the oldest producer and distributor of free ebooks.

According to Michael Hart (March 8, 1947 – September 6, 2011), founder of Project Gutenberg, the mission of Project Gutenberg is simple: to encourage the creation and distribution of eBooks.
This mission is, as much as possible, to encourage all those who are interested in making eBooks and helping to give them away.

Philosopher of science and occasional scientist. Mainly philosophy of evolutionary biology, philosophy of probability, implications of modeling and statistical inference in evolutionary biology. New book, Evolution and the Machinery of Chance, 2023. Sometimes I write biological or social science simulations to investigate or illustrate philosophical or other theoretical ideas in biology or anthropology. (Favorite languages: Clojure, Idris (learning), OCaml, Haskell, NetLogo, R.)

note: I’m a college professor immersed in #teaching and #ecology. I visit lots of places, combine observations and simple experiments, and look for generalities.
